name: Menu

fields.name: id
fields.label: Menu
fields.help_text: The menu tree is the page structure which generates the items in the menu. A single menu tree can be used with multiple menus. You can create multiple menus for complex website structures. Menus are created and managed in your Content Settings

fields.name: root_type
fields.label: Advanced menu type
fields.help_text: Advanced menus show different portions of a menu tree based on which page is being viewed.
choices: Static - Always show top-level pages in menu
Dynamic by section - Show pages in menu that are related to section being viewed
Dynamic by page - Show pages in menu that are related to page being viewed
Breadcrumb style path menu (uses horizontal flow)

fields.name: max_levels
fields.label: Max levels
fields.help_text: Determines the number of menu tree children that can be expanded in the menu

fields.name: flow
fields.label: Orientation
fields.help_text: Horizontal menus display items side-by-side, and vertical menus are top-to-bottom

fields.name: flyouts
fields.label: Enable flyouts?
fields.help_text: Child menu items will appear when you hover over the parent. If unchecked, child menu items will always appear

source:
{% set menu_id = module.id || module.menu %}
{% menu id="{{ menu_id }}", root_type="{{ module.root_type }}", flyouts="{{ module.flyouts }}", max_levels="{{ module.max_levels }}", flow="{{ module.flow }}" %}
label: Menu
